text: Kameron and Gabriella thrilled to see
their father he's been gone for six long
weeks Eric's in jail charged with
burglary his children are too young to
visit with his wife Sheena you seen him
through glass over there you can't touch
the separation from Eric has taken its
toll when I go to school and he's there
but with technology similar to Skype
Eric Mansfield and thousands of other
inmates can call their families from
jail around the holidays this means a
lot it's made a big difference like
what's the big smile on my face it makes
it bigger my a lot easier Portsmouth
Virginia is one of many places across
America that's adopting what's called
video visitation for the companies
involved it's big business here Gary
Humphries company operates in prisons
across 17 states charging 50 cents a
minute for the service some people would
say that your profiteering from the
vulnerable who are desperate to speak to
their relatives in prison what would you
say to that the fact that we set up our
model based on nonprofit Virginia had a
non-profit video visitation program that
was geared around 50 cents a minute and
we heard our model exactly the same as
theirs so I wouldn't consider
profiteering I mean we're able to do it
for the same price yet you know make a
modest profit off of it the question is
whether this new technology could
ultimately replace visits from prisoners
families altogether that's already
happened in the District of Columbia as
prisons face pressure to cut costs do
inmates risk losing that human contact
which can help with their rehabilitation
open to please
that's not a concern for Sheriff Bill
Watson who runs the maximum security
jail where Eric's imprisoned I would
like to see it replaced personal
visitations we could do a lot easier a
lot quicker why I'm cost-effective you
don't have to remove the inmates back
and forth you don't need the extra body
it's the extra deputies to move these
inmates back and forth for now
Portsmouth Jail allows both family
visits and video visits Sheena still
wants to see her husband in person I
will probably at least go up once a
month you know at least to me it doesn't
feel right if I don't for her girls a
virtual visit is so much better than
nothing
Lords rebellion BBC News Portsmouth
Virginia
